intro: Drimia johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's dragon's tongue, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
